(b) For the system consisting of the block and Earth, describe how the mechanical energy of the system changes, if at all, as the block moves from <math alttext="x equals positive D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (c) Graph 3 above incorrectly represents the horizontal position of the block as a function of time. Identify a feature of the graph that does not correctly represent the motion of the block. Justify your answer.

How does the period of the block’s oscillation on Track 2 compare to the period of the block’s oscillation on Track 1? Justify your answer.

Whether or not this equation is correct, is the equation consistent with your answer to part (d)?

(f) When the block reaches <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> at the bottom of the circular track, is the force exerted by the track on the block greater than, less than, or equal to the weight of the block?
